description:
Dipodascopsis tothii is a species of yeast-like fungus belonging to the phylum Ascomycota. It was first isolated from soil samples collected in Hungary and named after the Hungarian mycologist, Géza Tóth.

Dipodascopsis tothii is a haploid, heterothallic organism, meaning it has a sexual life cycle that involves the fusion of two compatible mating types. The vegetative cells are spherical to ellipsoidal in shape and reproduce asexually through budding.

The sexual stage of the life cycle involves the formation of conjugation tubes between compatible mating types, followed by the development of asci (singular: ascus) containing ascospores. The ascospores are released and can initiate new haploid individuals.

Phylogenetically, Dipodascopsis tothii is closely related to other members of the Dipodascaceae family, which are known for their ability to produce extracellular enzymes and potential applications in biotechnology.
